transactionDescription.helpText: The text here will be the title of the report and should be entered in the following format: Currency, Facility, Amount, Facility Ranking (e.g. Senior Mezzanine) credit facilities/credit facility to Borrower Name

questions.questionText: Select from a list of commonly used lenders
Enter Additional Lenders
questions.helpText: Use this field to enter lenders not listed in 1.1 above.  Each lender should be separated by a semi-colon.  If no lender is chosen from 1.1, you must enter at least one lender in this field.

questions.questionText: Does the credit agreement contain a guarantor coverage covenant?

questionContainers.containerText: Does the credit agreement contain obligations for the borrower to provide the following to the agent/lenders:

questions.questionText: All documents dispatched by the borrower to its shareholders or its creditors generally?
Details of any litigation, arbitration or administrative proceedings?
Notification of any default?
Further information on request regarding the financial condition, business or operations of any member of the group?
Notification of any change in ownership/shareholding of the group?
Notification of any changes in the constitutive documents of any obligor?
Consolidated annual financial statements?
Consolidated semi-annual financial statements?
Consolidated quarterly financial statements?
Consolidated monthly financial statements?
Unconsolidated annual financial statements?
Unconsolidated semi-annual financial statements?
Unconsolidated quarterly financial statements?
Unconsolidated monthly financial statements?
Is failure to pay an event a default?

childQuestions.questionText: Is there a grace period for a non-payment event of default?
Is this for market disruption, technical or administration error only?
Is there a grace period for a non-payment event of default?

questions.questionText: Is there a material adverse changed event of a default?
What cross-default or cross acceleration is provided for?

questionContainers.containerText: What is the cross-default or cross-acceleration threshold?

questions.questionText: Does the credit aggreement contain a set-off clause in favour of the lender?
Governing law of principal credit aggreement:
Does the credit aggreement provide for arbitration?
Voting level for most decisions?
Can a lender split its commitments/loans when voting?
Details of split voting (if applicable):
Can the hedge counterparties vote before enforcement?
Can the hedge counterparties vote after enforcement?
List the Obligors by name, juristiction and whether they are a borrower, guarantor, and/or security provider on a new line for each below: E.g. Name, Jurisdiction, Borrower
Do all guarantors guarantee all borrowings?
Does the agreement allow additional borrowers?
Consent level for additional borrowers in existing juridictions:

values.text: Non-standard consent level (i.e. Not all lender or majority lender (66 2/3%))

questions.questionText: Consent level for additional borrowers in new juridictions:

values.text: Non-standard consent level (i.e. Not all lender or majority lender (66 2/3%))

questions.questionText: Does the aggreement allow additional guarantors:

values.text: Non-standard consent level (i.e. Not all lender or majority lender (66 2/3%))

values.text: Non-standard consent level (i.e. Not all lender or majority lender (66 2/3%))

questions.questionText: Consent level for additional guarantors in new juridictions:

values.text: Non-standard consent level (i.e. Not all lender or majority lender (66 2/3%))

questions.questionText: Is there security?
Brief description of security:
What laws govern the security agreements?
Is there an intercreditor/subordination/priority agreement?
Do the hedge counterparties benefit from the security?
Have the original security documents been provided to the security trustee facility agent?

questionContainers.containerText: When an event of default is outstanding, are the following permitted?

questions.questionText: Transfer to existing lenders:

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Disclosure to existing lenders:

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Transfer to banks and financial institutions:

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Disclosure to banks and financial institutions:

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Transfer to any other person, trust, fund or entity regularly engaged or established for the purpose of making loans (ie any potential counterparty)?

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Disclosure to any other person, trust, fund or entity regularly engaged or established for the purpose of making loans (ie any potensial counterparty)?

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Is there a requirement for any potential transferee to be regulated, hold a banking licence etc?

questions.questionText: Transfer to existing lenders:

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Transfer to banks and financial institutions:

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

values.text: With consent (not to be unreasonably witheld

questions.questionText: Is there a requirement for any potential transferee to be regulated, hold a banking licence etc?
Would a potential transferee be required to enter into a non-disclosure agreement?
If consent is required for any transfer, is it deemed given if not refused?
Is the consent of any issuing bank, agent or trustee required for a transfer?
In exceptional circumstances only, please provide any other relevant information for transfer (e.g. exceptional restrictions, transfer requirements)
Can lenders grant security over their rights?
Permitted interest periods

questionContainers.containerText: What consent requirements are there for non-standard interest periods (if any)
Notice period for submitting a utilisation request for sterling
Notice period for submitting a utilisation request for non-sterling
Notice period for prepayment of loans
Notice period for cancellation of commitments

questions.questionText: What is the initial margin (% per annum)?
Are there commitment fees?

childQuestions.questionText: If yes and only if details are set out in the credit aggreement (rather than in separate fee letters), type details directly into the box

questions.questionText: Are there utilisation fees?

childQuestions.questionText: If yes and only if details are set out in the credit aggreement (rather than in separate fee letters), type details directly into the box

questions.questionText: Does the margin vary (by references to a margin grid or otherwise)?

childQuestions.questionText: If yes, type in the box what the variation is based on (e.g. leverage, ratings, other financial covernants) and the maximum and minimum amounts.

questions.questionText: Does the credit agreement contain a concept of Defaulting Lenders?
Can Obligors set off against money owed to Defaulting Lenders?
Agent type (E.g. Facility agent, security agent) and agent name?

questions.helpText: E.G. Does the credit agreement include a provision regarding regarding sanctions?
